title: Real Madrid 'reject £25m offer from Arsenal for Dani Ceballos'
text:
Real Madrid have reportedly rebuffed an attempt from Arsenal to sign Dani Ceballos permanently.

The Spaniard is on loan at Arsenal this season and has impressed during his brief stint at the club despite being used in rotation by Unai Emery.

According to El Desmarque, Arsenal offered in the region of £25million in a bid to secure Ceballos on a permanent basis, but Madrid have turned it down.

Real Madrid reportedly rejected a £25m bid from Arsenal to sign Dani Ceballos permanently

They claim Madrid have significantly dropped their valuation of the player but are demanding at least £30m for him.

Ceballos joined the La Liga giants in 2017 but has been very much on the periphery, making just 17 league appearances for the club over the past two seasons.

He is also said to have a strained relationship with boss Zinedine Zidane, who had been eager to sign an attack-minded midfielder in the summer.

Ceballos has spoken to Madrid president Florentino Perez about his wishes to join Arsenal

Earlier this week, Spanish reports claimed that Ceballos has spoken to Madrid president Florentino Perez directly about his wish to join Arsenal permanently.

The 23-year-old has already notched up 12 appearances for Emery’s side in all competitions this campaign and has been one of their better performers.

Arsenal legend Ian Wright has liked what he has seen of Ceballos so far and pleaded with Emery to start him more often following their recent defeat against newly-promoted side Sheffield United.

He told Premier League Productions: 'I think Ceballos has to play. He's [Emery] played the youngsters and I'm pleased to see them in there, with [Bukayo] Saka.

Ceballos came off the bench for Arsenal during Monday's 1-0 defeat at Sheffield United

'But Saka, for an 18-year-old, if you're leaving [Mesut] Ozil totally out of the squad, then we have to see more from him [Saka], we have to see more from Joe [Willock].

'Unfortunately, it was a game where it passed them both by and then it comes down to the manager and his choices.

'He's made the change at half-time, with Ceballos, so you're thinking to yourself: "Why didn't you start him in the first place?"
description: According to El Desmarque, Arsenal offered in the region of £25million in a bid to secure Dani Ceballos on a permanent basis, but Real Madrid turned it down.
